meanings: (허점, 금전적 손실) (법의 허점) loophole; (금전적 손실) loss
small store[shop], (Am) mom-and-pop store, (Brit) corner shop

vlive.english: There's a hole. - Is there a hole?

vlive.english: Don't we have a small one?

vlive.korean: [옷소매 구멍이 어디야?] [Where is the hole?] View video TOMORROW X TOGETHER : TO DO X TOMORROW X TOGETHER 2020 - EP.4

examples.korean: He drilled through the wall by mistake. 발음듣기 그가 실수로 벽에 구멍을 뚫었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He drilled through the wall by mistake. 발음

examples.korean: First, scoop a hole in the soil. 발음듣기 먼저 흙을 파내어서 구멍을 하나 만들어라. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: First, scoop a hole in the soil. 발음

examples.korean: A thread of light emerged from the keyhole. 발음듣기 열쇠 구멍에서 한 줄기 불빛이 새어나오고 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: A thread of light emerged from the keyhole. 발음

examples.korean: He was wearing a carnation in his buttonhole. 발음듣기 그는 양복 단추 구멍에 카네이션 한 송이를 꽂고 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He was wearing a carnation in his buttonhole. 발음

examples.korean: The kids poked holes in the ice with sticks. 발음듣기 그 아이들이 막대기로 얼음에 구멍을 냈다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The kids poked holes in the ice with sticks. 발음
